Title(s): The Balade of Pite; Compleint to his Lady
_description: ‘The Balade of Pite’ or ‘A Compleint to his Lady’ — 130 lines in various stanza forms

BLAdd34360.First Lines:
The longe nyghtis whan euery creatureShuld have theyr rest in
                    somwhat be kynde…
BLAdd34360.Last Lines:
…ffor ellis may me last no blisse ne hopeNe dwelle withyn my
                    trouble careful hert
BLAdd34360.Note: Written as part of the ‘Compleynte to Pite’: see 4375.

BLHar78.First Lines:
Þe long nightes whane euery creatureShoulde haue þeyre
                    rest in somwhat as be kynde…
BLHar78.Last Lines:
…And for no maner gilt but my goode willeAls goode were
                    þanne vntrewe as truwe to be…
BLHar78.Note:
Ends imperfectly; written as part of the ‘Compleynte to
                    Pite’: see 4375.
